intro: Hieracium tingitanum, commonly known as the Tingitanian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, disc-like cluster. It is an important plant for local biodiversity and can sometimes be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
